org.drip.xva.hypothecation

Class BurgardKjaerVertexExposureAttribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drip.xva.hypothecation.BurgardKjaerVertexExposureAttribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollateralGroupVertexExposureAttibution

    public class BurgardKjaerVertexExposureAttribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements CollateralGroupVertexExposureAttibution
    BurgardKjaerVertexExposureAttribution holds the Credit, the Debt, and the Funding Exposures, as well as the Collateral Balances at each Re-hypothecation Collateral Group using the Burgard Kjaer (2014) Scheme. The References are: - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): PDE Representations of Derivatives with Bilateral Counter-party Risk and Funding Costs, Journal of Credit Risk, 7 (3) 1-19. - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): In the Balance, Risk, 24 (11) 72-75. - Gregory, J. (2009): Being Two-faced over Counter-party Credit Risk, Risk 20 (2) 86-90. - Li, B., and Y. Tang (2007): Quantitative Analysis, Derivatives Modeling, and Trading Strategies in the Presence of Counter-party Credit Risk for the Fixed Income Market, World Scientific Publishing, Singapore. - Piterbarg, V. (2010): Funding Beyond Discounting: Collateral Agreements and Derivatives Pricing, Risk 21 (2) 97-102.
    Author:
    Lakshmi Krishnamurthy
